title: Mavic 2 Zoom Unboxing and Review!
description: PLEASE SUBSCRIBE:  GET MY PINK iJUSTINE CABLES HERE:   GET MY EDITING PLUGIN:    MUSIC I USE -   FRIEND ME HERE:        MY NEW PROJECT:   PODCAST:       WHAT I USE TO MAKE VIDEOS    CAMERAS: Sony a7 IV -  Sony a1 -   Sony a7s III -   Insta 360 ONE X3 -  Insta 360 ONE RS -  Insta 360 GO2 -   LENSES: New Sony GM 24-70mm ii -  Older Sony GM 24-70mm -  New Sony Sony 20-70mm -  Sony GM 16-35mm -  Sony GM 50mm -  Sony GM 135mm -  Sony GM 85mm -   AUDIO:  Sennheiser AVX Digital Wireless -  Sony XLR Adapter -  Sony Hot Shoe Shotgun -  Tiny Sony Microphone -  DJI Mics -  Rode Podcaster Pro II -  Podcaster Mic -  Elgato Wave 3 Mic -   DRONES: DJI Mavic 3 -  DJI Mini 3 -  DJI Air 2S -   LIGHTING: Aputure 600d Pro -  Aputure Light Dome II -  Aputure Amaran 200d -  Aputure 35in Light Dome -  Aputure Lantern Softbox -   Sony CF Express A 160g + Card Reader-  Sony CF Express A 800g -     These links are affiliate and by using them youre helping out my channel! Thank you!     BECOME A CHANNEL MEMBER:
transcript: - Hey guys, it's Justine and I'm so excited because today we have got one of the Mavic 2 Zoom here to test out. There are two new drones in the Mavic family. There's this one. This is the Zoom and there is the Mavic 2 Pro version. Now what's exciting is both of these drones are the first of their kind in portable consumer drones. The Pro version has a Hasselblad camera with a 1 inch sensor and this one has a 24-48 mm optical zoom. I cannot wait to try out both versions, but today we've got the Zoom, so let's un-box. I'm also excited about the upgraded flight time. It says we'll get 31 minutes, which is great because more flight time, means more fun. (upbeat techno music) So here it is. We have got the controller. Looks to be a little bit bigger than a previous version and here's our drone-you're beefy! It does have a little bit of weight to it. It does feel a little heavier than the previous Mavic and by heavier, I mean, barely. Another box, another box, and another one. So before we get started, I want to give you guys a size comparison. So this is the Mavic Air and this is the brand new Mavic 2. So it is quite larger than the Mavic Air and now in comparison to the Mavic Pro Platinum. The Mavic 2 is a little bit taller. It's slightly heavier, like really not that much at all, but as for controllers, this is the Mavic Platinum. So this is a little bit thicker. One of the feature in the Mavic Air that I loved in the controller is the removable joysticks. They hide in here as a nice little storage compartment. That makes it so much easier to travel with these. So that's very exciting. Let's open this guy up and just see what it looks like all out. This looks like a much stronger gimbal than our previous versions. Oh yeah, this is industrial. This also now has Omnidirectional Obstacle Sensing, so that basically will give you way more coverage if you are coming up on obstacles. It's not entirely 360. It has top and bottom, left and right, and front and back. The left and right is only available with active track and tripod mode, but for the most part this is going to provide you with some really great coverage as far as obstacle avoidance. Here's our battery. Let's take a look at this. Whoa, this is way bigger than the other Mavic battery is. Here's the Mavic Platinum and here's the brand new Mavic 2 battery and it is way bigger. So that battery's dead, so I'm going to need to charge those before we go out. It's got a cable charger, extra propellers, and of course the paperwork. So here's two different cords. There's a micro USB, so for most Android phones and also USB C version for newer Android phones and hopefully one day the iPhone. Extra joysticks and here's our gimbal and lens protection. So it looks like it's got an extra little thing on it now. Now that our un-boxing is complete, it's time to update the firmware as soon as this battery charges and we're going to head outside. So, let's go! [Techno Music] The Mavic 2 Zoom is all set up and ready to go. I've updated the firmware. So basically what we're going to do right now, is I'm going to take it for a flight and see how it flies. Later on in the video, we're gunna be going into a little more depth of some of the features and some comparisons to some other drones that are out right now. But right now, I just want to fly this freakin thing, so let's, let's just go! Wait, let me calibrate first. I don't want to get to ahead of myself. Do you guys like my hat? I don't care if you don't like it. [Techno Music] You think I can fly it back through there? Of course I can. [Techno Music] Let's test out the zoom. So here's our zoom. So you can use this little guy. Ah, it so cool. Let's zoom into those trees. Zoom all the way out. [Techno Music] Quick shot. So here's the Dolly Zoom. [Techno Music] So now I just switched it to 60 frames a second. So let's see what we can do on two batteries and when the sun goes down. [Calming Music] Thank you guys so much for watching. I had so much fun shooting this video. It was a pretty quick turn around time. We basically shot this in a day and I'm now editing and it's 4 AM. There's so many more things I want to test out on this drone. I also can't wait to try out the Mavic 2 Pro. It's going to be really cool to see how that 1-inch sensor performs in different flying and lighting conditions. Hope you guys enjoy this. A huge thank you to Nathan for coming out and shooting this video with me. He's an incredible drone pilot. So it's really fun because when I'm not flying, I can be doing cool things and he can be getting cool drone shots of me doing cool things like riding a bike. Be sure to subscribe and hit the bell so you guys will see some more fun videos from me. Hopefully, very soon, but now you can go to bed. Enjoy. [Calming Music]
